(not sure if this is the right place to ask)
I just faced some weird errors, while drawing a perspective graph. In a not-full-screened graphics device, the plot came out just fine. However, if I try to maximize the graphics device, the plot gets stuck, at about half the complete plot and tries to redraw it again, and the loop continues, (almost) freezing my device. I have a hunch that the `border`  parameter inside `persp`  might be the culprit (as I gave it an rgb color with a bit of transparency, which might be complex). But I still want to know why it happens, only if I make it full screen, and if at all, it is a possible bug or not...
I am running `R 4.3.0`  in Windows 11
If anybody wants to reproduce the said anomaly, I am willing to share the script.
